translated: for the attainment of safety from bondage.
are one part of your life;
Live, good sir, life is better,
while living you can make merit.
And while you live the holy life,
what is the use of striving?
The path of striving is difficult,
hard to do, hard to accomplish.’
and stood in the presence of the Buddha.🔽The Fortunate One said this to Māra,
who was speaking in this way:
“You are a friend of the heedless, Evil One,
for what purpose have you come here?
But those for whom merit is useful,
I have faith, and likewise energy,
and wisdom is found in me.
why do you ask me about living?
are dried up by this wind.

analyzed: kiñca me pahitattassa  lohitam nu pasus saye
translated: And how much more so my blood,🔽which is not dried up by my intentness?
When the blood is drying up,
When the flesh is wasting away,
Clearer still is mindfulness and wisdom,
having attained the supreme state of sublime bliss,
my mind does not expect sensual pleasures.
See the purity of the being!
Sensual pleasures are your first army,
The third is hunger and thirst,
The fifth is sloth and torpor,

original: Makkho thambho te aṭṭhamo.🔽Lābho siloko sakkāro,🔽Micchāladdho ca yo yaso;
analyzed: makkhaḥ thambhaḥ te aṭṭhamaḥ  lābhaḥ silokaḥ sakkāro  micchā laddhaḥ ca yaḥ yaso
translated: deceit and obstinacy are your eighth.🔽Gain, fame, and honor,🔽and the glory that comes from wrong livelihood,
The non-hero does not conquer it,
And having conquered, he attains happiness.
Here I will abandon the reed,🔽Shame on my life!
It is better for me to die in battle,

analyzed: yat ce jīve parājitaḥ  pagāḷha ittha na dissanti

translated: Here some ascetics and brahmins are seen,
But they do not know the path

analyzed: yena gacchanti subbatā  samantā dhajinim disvā
translated: By which the well-behaved go.🔽Having seen the bannered army all around,
I will go forth to battle,
Do not remove me from my place.
What cannot be overcome by you,
I will pierce it with wisdom,
Like a raw hide with a thorn.
I will wander from country to country,
Where having gone, they will not grieve.”
I have followed you step by step;
I will not find an opportunity
in the One Awakened, the one with mindfulness.🔽Like a bird that circles a rock
like a crow pecking at a rock,

analyzed: tattha iva antaradhāyatha ati 🔽padhāna suttam dutiya
translated: disappeared right there.”🔽The Second Discourse on Exertion is finished.
